comment.author: 20727502@N00
20727502@N00
comment._content: FYI. Cork City Library (not quite as salubrious as "library towers", but a great resource none-the less) has quite a few aerial photos of Cork from the 1930s and 1940s. Some taken by the Defence Forces. Others by private companies like "Aerofilms" and the like. AAAANYWAY, here's an aerial photo of the college surrounds from the 1940s. The garden from the NLI photo is the open expanse at the "tip" of the arm of the east wing of the quadrangle. Above the dark area of trees. The biology building (with accompanying greenhouse) is is seen "above" this expanse. (And "below" the church building - which is the Honan chapel). The Honan Chapel is still there. The biology building and greenhouse was demolished in recent decades.
